main_definition: The head of the Roman Catholic Church, considered a religious leader with spiritual authority over Catholics worldwide.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Title for the Bishop of Rome and leader of the Roman Catholic Church.
meanings_and_examples.example: Pope Francis is currently leading the Catholic Church.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A person who claims to be a pope, often used humorously or sarcastically.
meanings_and_examples.example: He thinks he's the pope because he wears white robes every day.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An ecclesiastical title given historically to certain high-ranking bishops in some Christian denominations, not just limited to Catholicism.
meanings_and_examples.example: The Archbishop of Canterbury is often referred to as the 'pope' of Anglicanism.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A figurative expression used when someone tries to assert authority or control over a situation, similar to saying one 'takes charge.'
meanings_and_examples.example: When she entered the room, he immediately said, 'I am the pope now and you will do as I say.'

meanings_and_examples.definition: An old-fashioned term used in some regions or communities to refer to a respected elder or leader, not strictly religious.
meanings_and_examples.example: In our village, he is seen as the pope due to his age and wisdom.
